node.title: Four-year, $67.5m Aotea Centre revamp completed
node.description: The refurbishment is one of a series of development projects and street upgrades to help revitalise the central city.

node.title: Fiordland tourist operators keen to put 'diabolical' years behind them
node.description: The tourists are coming back, but will one of the country's most special destinations be ready for them?

node.title: Company allowed to search for oil and gas off Taranaki coast despite ban
node.description: An environmentalist says a decision to allow an oil and gas company to search off the coast of Taranaki shows the 2018 exploration ban is not genuine.

node.title: Covid-19 experts urge caution as Cabinet reviews red light setting
node.description: Prepare to bid farewell to vaccine passes and many workplace mandates - at least for now - but the next question is whether any regions are ready to have restrictions eased.

node.title: Firefighters worry wind change could spread blaze at Awarua
node.description: Firefighters are worried a wind change today could see a large blaze on conservation wetlands at Awarua, south of Invercargill, spread further. Audio

node.title: Democracy denied? Why commissioners replace councils
node.description: The Detail - Commissioners will stay on at Tauranga City Council until 2024 - are locals being denied their democratic rights or is more time needed to get the city back on track?

node.title: Do insects, octopus and other invertebrates feel emotions?
node.description: The question of physical and emotional experience has moved beyond humans to animals.

node.title: Ukrainians curse Russian invaders as dead civilians found in liberated towns
node.description: In the liberated town of Bucha, Mayor Anatoliy Fedoruk said more than 300 residents had been killed.

node.title: Ross Taylor wants to contribute one last time
node.description: New Zealand veteran batsman Ross Taylor says he wants to make a contribution and enjoy the occasion when he plays his final match for the Black Caps today.

node.title: Making learning fun again: Educators look forward to finally getting out of the classroom
node.description: After two years of lockdowns and restricted group sizes, schools say it is vital for children that learning is again made interactive and exciting.

node.title: Austrian aristocrat gets green light to buy farm for forestry conversion
node.description: An Austrian aristocrat has been given approval to buy another farm in Aotearoa and plant pine trees in it.

node.title: Northland trial in pursuit of the perfect peanut ...
node.description: Country Life - Eight peanut varieties are being trialled in Northland to find out whether New Zealand can grow peanuts suitable for peanut butter. Audio

node.title: Cricket legend Ross Taylor plays his 450th and final game for NZ today
node.description: For the past 16 years, fans of New Zealand cricket could feel safe in the knowledge that as long as Ross Taylor was still at the crease we were in with a shot. Audio

node.title: Positive Covid-19 cases may be under-reported - modeller
node.description: A Covid-19 modeller suspects there may be more cases than reported in the community because people aren't recording their results.

node.title: Moon rocket fueling test delayed
node.description: Engineers will try to complete a practice countdown and fueling test Monday for NASA's huge Artemis moon rocket.

node.title: Nine helicopters and eight ground crews to fight Southland blaze
node.description: Extra fire crews are being brought in today to try and contain a large blaze on conservation wetlands at Awarua, south of Invercargill.

node.title: 'Perfect storm' leads to new record low consumer confidence
node.description: The ANZ-Roy Morgan Consumer Confidence Index for March is down four points to 77.9, the lowest since the survey began in 2004.

node.title: Full transcript of "Face the Nation" on April 3, 2022

node.title: Morning light and health: 'You need light to time your life'

node.title: China to drop tariffs on 12 wood and paper products imported from NZ
node.description: The move, which comes into effect from Thursday, covers products such as toilet tissue and writing paper.

node.title: 1 killed, at least 10 shot in shooting at Dallas outdoor concert
node.description: One person was killed and 10 others were injured during a shooting at an outdoor concert in Dallas.

node.title: House panel lacks full view of Trump's actions on January 6, Raskin says
node.description: "We have no comprehensive, fine-grained portrait of what was going on during that period, and that's obviously of intense interest to us," Raskin said.

node.title: Grammys 2022: Complete list of nominees and winners
node.description: Trevor Noah, who hosted the ceremony in 2021, will return to host once again this year.

node.title: Rock is America's favorite music, just not among young people
